paragraphs.content: Chapter 33
paragraphs.contentHtml: Chapter 33

paragraphs.content: Wherefore, Job, I pray thee, hear my speeches, and hearken to all my words.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Wherefore, Job, I pray thee, hear my speeches, and hearken to all my words.

paragraphs.content: Behold, now I have opened my mouth, my tongue hath spoken in my mouth.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Behold, now I have opened my mouth, my tongue hath spoken in my mouth.

paragraphs.content: My words shall be of the uprightness of my heart: and my lips shall utter knowledge clearly.
paragraphs.contentHtml: My words shall be of the uprightness of my heart: and my lips shall utter knowledge clearly.

paragraphs.content: The Spirit of God hath made me, and the breath of the Almighty hath given me life.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The Spirit of God hath made me, and the breath of the Almighty hath given me life.

paragraphs.content: If thou canst answer me, set thy words in order before me, stand up.
paragraphs.contentHtml: If thou canst answer me, set thy words in order before me, stand up.

paragraphs.content: Behold, I am according to thy wish in God’s stead: I also am formed out of the clay.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Behold, I am according to thy wish in God’s stead: I also am formed out of the clay.

paragraphs.content: Behold, my terror shall not make thee afraid, neither shall my hand be heavy upon thee.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Behold, my terror shall not make thee afraid, neither shall my hand be heavy upon thee.

paragraphs.content: Surely thou hast spoken in mine hearing, and I have heard the voice of thy words, saying,
paragraphs.contentHtml: Surely thou hast spoken in mine hearing, and I have heard the voice of thy words, saying,

paragraphs.content: I am clean without transgression, I am innocent; neither is there iniquity in me.
paragraphs.contentHtml: I am clean without transgression, I am innocent; neither is there iniquity in me.

paragraphs.content: Behold, he findeth occasions against me, he counteth me for his enemy,
paragraphs.contentHtml: Behold, he findeth occasions against me, he counteth me for his enemy,

paragraphs.content: He putteth my feet in the stocks, he marketh all my paths.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He putteth my feet in the stocks, he marketh all my paths.

paragraphs.content: Behold, in this thou art not just: I will answer thee, that God is greater than man.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Behold, in this thou art not just: I will answer thee, that God is greater than man.

paragraphs.content: Why dost thou strive against him? for he giveth not account of any of his matters.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Why dost thou strive against him? for he giveth not account of any of his matters.

paragraphs.content: For God speaketh once, yea twice, yet man perceiveth it not.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For God speaketh once, yea twice, yet man perceiveth it not.

paragraphs.content: In a dream, in a vision of the night, when deep sleep falleth upon men, in slumberings upon the bed;
paragraphs.contentHtml: In a dream, in a vision of the night, when deep sleep falleth upon men, in slumberings upon the bed;

paragraphs.content: Then he openeth the ears of men, and sealeth their instruction,
paragraphs.contentHtml: Then he openeth the ears of men, and sealeth their instruction,

paragraphs.content: That he may withdraw man from his purpose, and hide pride from man.
paragraphs.contentHtml: That he may withdraw man from his purpose, and hide pride from man.

paragraphs.content: He keepeth back his soul from the pit, and his life from perishing by the sword.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He keepeth back his soul from the pit, and his life from perishing by the sword.

paragraphs.content: He is chastened also with pain upon his bed, and the multitude of his bones with strong pain:
paragraphs.contentHtml: He is chastened also with pain upon his bed, and the multitude of his bones with strong pain:

paragraphs.content: So that his life abhorreth bread, and his soul dainty meat.
paragraphs.contentHtml: So that his life abhorreth bread, and his soul dainty meat.

paragraphs.content: His flesh is consumed away, that it cannot be seen; and his bones that were not seen stick out.
paragraphs.contentHtml: His flesh is consumed away, that it cannot be seen; and his bones that were not seen stick out.

paragraphs.content: Yea, his soul draweth near unto the grave, and his life to the destroyers.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Yea, his soul draweth near unto the grave, and his life to the destroyers.

paragraphs.content: If there be a messenger with him, an interpreter, one among a thousand, to shew unto man his uprightness:
paragraphs.contentHtml: If there be a messenger with him, an interpreter, one among a thousand, to shew unto man his uprightness:

paragraphs.content: Then he is gracious unto him, and saith, Deliver him from going down to the pit: I have found a ransom.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Then he is gracious unto him, and saith, Deliver him from going down to the pit: I have found a ransom.

paragraphs.content: His flesh shall be fresher than a child’s: he shall return to the days of his youth:
paragraphs.contentHtml: His flesh shall be fresher than a child’s: he shall return to the days of his youth:

paragraphs.content: He shall pray unto God, and he will be favourable unto him: and he shall see his face with joy: for he will render unto man his righteousness.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He shall pray unto God, and he will be favourable unto him: and he shall see his face with joy: for he will render unto man his righteousness.

paragraphs.content: He looketh upon men, and if any say, I have sinned, and perverted that which was right, and it profited me not;
paragraphs.contentHtml: He looketh upon men, and if any say, I have sinned, and perverted that which was right, and it profited me not;

paragraphs.content: He will deliver his soul from going into the pit, and his life shall see the light.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He will deliver his soul from going into the pit, and his life shall see the light.

paragraphs.content: Lo, all these things worketh God oftentimes with man,
paragraphs.contentHtml: Lo, all these things worketh God oftentimes with man,

paragraphs.content: To bring back his soul from the pit, to be enlightened with the light of the living.
paragraphs.contentHtml: To bring back his soul from the pit, to be enlightened with the light of the living.

paragraphs.content: Mark well, O Job, hearken unto me: hold thy peace, and I will speak.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Mark well, O Job, hearken unto me: hold thy peace, and I will speak.

paragraphs.content: If thou hast any thing to say, answer me: speak, for I desire to justify thee.
paragraphs.contentHtml: If thou hast any thing to say, answer me: speak, for I desire to justify thee.

paragraphs.content: If not, hearken unto me: hold thy peace, and I shall teach thee wisdom.
paragraphs.contentHtml: If not, hearken unto me: hold thy peace, and I shall teach thee wisdom.
